field.name: unparsedInsertString
field.String: operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.ChangeAttributeOperation', arg-elementLocation, '.', arg-name, '', arg-namespace, '', arg-value, '', arg-removeIfEmpty, 'true', arg-editAttribute, 'true'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Add/change/remove an attribute of an element.


Arguments:
  • elementLocation = An XPath expression indicating the element whose attribute will be changed. Note: If it is not defined then the element at the caret position will be used.
  • name = The attribute local name.
  • namespace = The attribute namespace. Leave it empty for no namespace.
  • value = The attribute value. Set it empty to remove the attribute.
  • removeIfEmpty = True means that the attribute should be removed if an empty value is provided. The default behavior is to remove it.
  • editAttribute = If an in-place editor exists for this attribute, it will automatically activate the in-pace editor and it will start editing.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.ChangeAttributeOperation',
arg-elementLocation, '.',
arg-name, '',
arg-namespace, '',
arg-value, '',
arg-removeIfEmpty, 'true',
arg-editAttribute, 'true'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Add/change/remove one or more attributes for one or more elements.


Arguments:
  • elementLocations = An XPath expression indicating the elements whose attributes will be affected. Note: If it is not defined, then the element at the caret position will be used.
  • attributeNames = The names of the attributes to change/insert/remove, each on a new line. The provided values can be local names or Clark notations {attribute_namespace}attibute_name.
  • values = The attribute values, each on a new line. An empty value will remove the corresponding attribute if 'removeIfEmpty' is set to 'true' (it is by default).
  • removeIfEmpty = 'true' means the attribute should be removed if an empty value is provided. The default value is 'true'.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.ChangeAttributesOperation',
arg-elementLocations, '.',
arg-attributeNames, '',
arg-values, '',
arg-removeIfEmpty, 'true'

field.name: unparsedInsertString
field.String: operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.ChangePseudoClassesOperation', arg-setLocations, '.', arg-setPseudoClassNames, '', arg-removeLocations, '.', arg-removePseudoClassNames, '', arg-includeAllNodes, 'no'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Sets a set of pseudo classes to all nodes identified by an XPath expression. Removes a set of pseudo classes from all nodes identified by an XPath expression.


Arguments:
  • setLocations = An XPath expression indicating a list of nodes on which the specified list of pseudo classes will be set. Note: If it is not defined, then the element at the caret position will be used.
  • setPseudoClassNames = A space-separated list of pseudo class names which will be set on the matched nodes.
  • removeLocations = An XPath expression indicating a list of nodes from which the specified list of pseudo classes will be removed. Note: If it is not defined, then the element at the caret position will be used.
  • removePseudoClassNames = A space-separated list of pseudo class names which will be removed from the matched nodes.
  • includeAllNodes = The value should be "yes" in order to include comments, text and CDATA nodes in the XPath execution, "no" to ignore them.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.ChangePseudoClassesOperation',
arg-setLocations, '.',
arg-setPseudoClassNames, '',
arg-removeLocations, '.',
arg-removePseudoClassNames, '',
arg-includeAllNodes, 'no'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Deletes the element specified by an XPath expression or the element at the caret position


Arguments:
  • elementLocation = An XPath expression indicating the element to be deleted. Note: If it is not defined, then the element at the caret position will be used.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.DeleteElementOperation',
arg-elementLocation, '.'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Deletes the elements specified by an XPath expression or the element at the caret position


Arguments:
  • elementLocations = An XPath expression indicating the elements to be deleted. Note: If it is not defined then the element at the caret position will be used.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.DeleteElementsOperation',
arg-elementLocations, '.'

field.name: unparsedInsertString
field.String: operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.ExecuteCommandLineOperation', arg-name, 'Command Line Operation', arg-workingDirectory, '.', arg-cmdLine, '', arg-showConsole, 'false', arg-wait, 'false'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Author operation allowing the execution of command lines.


Arguments:
  • name = The name of the operation. It will also be used as the name of the console.
  • workingDirectory = The path to the working directory where the command line will be executed.
  • cmdLine = The command line to be executed. It can contain oXygen editor variables. IMPORTANT: This operation is meant for executing programs. Not any string that a command line interpreter (or shell) accepts can be run by this operation.For example, the "dir" command line from Windows is not accepted as it is. The accepted form is "cmd /c dir".
  • showConsole = True to show the console when running the command line.
  • wait = True to wait until the command terminates to return.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.ExecuteCommandLineOperation',
arg-name, 'Command Line Operation',
arg-workingDirectory, '.',
arg-cmdLine, '',
arg-showConsole, 'false',
arg-wait, 'false'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Run a named transformation scenario with specific parameters defined in the associated document type.


Arguments:
  • scenarioName = The name of the transformation scenario which will be executed.
  • scenarioParameters = Provided parameters for the transformation scenario. Parameters are inserted as name=value pairs separated by line breaks. The set parameters are taken into account for XSLT, DITA, Chemistry and ANT Transformation scenario types.
  • markInProgressXPathLocation = XPath expression that identifies the element(s) on which a specific '-oxy-transformation-in-progress' pseudo class is set before transformation is started.The pseudo class is reset when the transformation ends.If this XPath expression is not defined, the current node is used.
  • markOthersInProgressXPathLocation = XPath expression that indentifies other elements on which a specific '-oxy-transformation-in-progress-others' pseudo class is set before the transformation is started.The pseudo class is reset when the transformation ends.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.ExecuteCustomizableTransformationScenarioOperation',
arg-scenarioName, '',
arg-scenarioParameters, '',
arg-markInProgressXPathLocation, '',
arg-markOthersInProgressXPathLocation, ''

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Run a sequence of actions defined in the associated document type.


Arguments:
  • actionIDs = The IDs of the actions that will be executed in sequence, separated either by new lines or by commas.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.ExecuteMultipleActionsOperation',
arg-actionIDs, ''

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Run a sequence of actions defined in the associated document type.


Arguments:
  • actionIDs = The IDs of the actions that will be executed in sequence, separated either by new lines or by commas.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.ExecuteMultipleWebappCompatibleActionsOperation',
arg-actionIDs, ''

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Run a named transformation scenario defined in the associated document type.


Arguments:
  • scenarioNames = The names of the transformation scenario which will be executed, separated by new lines.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.ExecuteTransformationScenariosOperation',
arg-scenarioNames, ''

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Run a named validation scenario defined in the associated document type.


Arguments:
  • scenarioNames = The names of the validation scenario which will be executed, separated by new lines.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.ExecuteValidationScenariosOperation',
arg-scenarioNames, ''

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Insert a MathML equation.


Arguments:
  • fragment = The fragment of XML containing the default MathML content which should be inserted

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.InsertEquationOperation',
arg-fragment, ''

field.name: unparsedInsertString
field.String: operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.InsertFragmentOperation', arg-fragment, '<element/>', arg-insertLocation, '.', arg-insertPosition, 'Inside as first child', arg-schemaAware, 'true', arg-insertEvenIfInvalid, 'true', arg-goToNextEditablePosition, 'true'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Insert a document fragment.


Arguments:
  • fragment = The fragment to be inserted
  • insertLocation = An XPath expression indicating the insert location for the fragment. Note: If it is not defined then the insert location will be at the caret.
  • insertPosition = The insert position relative to the node determined by the XPath expression. Can be: Before, Inside as first child, Inside as last child or After. Note: If the XPath expression is not defined this argument is ignored
  • schemaAware = Controlling if the insertion is schema aware or not. When is enabled and the fragments insertion is not allowed, a dialog will be shown proposing one of following solutions if they apply: - insert the fragments inside a new element. The name of the element to wrap the fragments in is computed by analyzing the left or right siblings; - split an ancestor of the node at insertion offset and insert the fragments between the resulted elements; - insert the fragments somewhere in the proximity of the insertion offset(left or right without skipping content); - insert at offset the plain text resulted after removing the mark-up; - insert the fragments at insertion offset, even they are not allowed. Can be: true, false. Default value is true.
  • insertEvenIfInvalid = True to insert the fragment even if invalid, when 'schemaAware' is set to 'true'.
  • goToNextEditablePosition = After inserting the fragment, the first editable position is detected and the caret is placed at that location. It handles any in-place editors used to edit attributes. It will be ignored if the fragment specifies a caret position using the caret editor variable.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.InsertFragmentOperation',
arg-fragment, '',
arg-insertLocation, '.',
arg-insertPosition, 'Inside as first child',
arg-schemaAware, 'true',
arg-insertEvenIfInvalid, 'true',
arg-goToNextEditablePosition, 'true'

field.name: unparsedInsertString
field.String: operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.InsertOrReplaceFragmentOperation', arg-fragment, '<element/>', arg-insertLocation, '.', arg-insertPosition, 'Inside as first child', arg-schemaAware, 'true', arg-goToNextEditablePosition, 'true'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Insert a document fragment. If selection is present, the selection will be replaced with the given fragment.


Arguments:
  • fragment = The fragment to be inserted
  • insertLocation = An XPath expression indicating the insert location for the fragment. Note: If it is not defined then the insert location will be at the caret.
  • insertPosition = The insert position relative to the node determined by the XPath expression. Can be: Before, Inside as first child, Inside as last child, Replace or After. Note: If the XPath expression is not defined this argument is ignored
  • schemaAware = Controlling if the insertion is schema aware or not. When is enabled and the fragments insertion is not allowed, a dialog will be shown proposing one of following solutions if they apply: - insert the fragments inside a new element. The name of the element to wrap the fragments in is computed by analyzing the left or right siblings; - split an ancestor of the node at insertion offset and insert the fragments between the resulted elements; - insert the fragments somewhere in the proximity of the insertion offset(left or right without skipping content); - insert at offset the plain text resulted after removing the mark-up; - insert the fragments at insertion offset, even they are not allowed. Can be: true, false. Default value is true.
  • goToNextEditablePosition = After inserting the fragment, the first editable position is detected and the caret is placed at that location. It handles any in-place editors used to edit attributes. It will be ignored if the fragment specifies a caret position using the caret editor variable.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.InsertOrReplaceFragmentOperation',
arg-fragment, '',
arg-insertLocation, '.',
arg-insertPosition, 'Inside as first child',
arg-schemaAware, 'true',
arg-goToNextEditablePosition, 'true'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Insert a simple text. If selection is present, the selected text will be replaced with the new one.


Arguments:
  • text = The text to be inserted
  • schemaAware = Controlling if the insertion is schema aware or not. When is enabled and the fragments insertion is not allowed, a dialog will be shown proposing one of following solutions if they apply: - insert the fragments inside a new element. The name of the element to wrap the fragments in is computed by analyzing the left or right siblings; - split an ancestor of the node at insertion offset and insert the fragments between the resulted elements; - insert the fragments somewhere in the proximity of the insertion offset(left or right without skipping content); - insert at offset the plain text resulted after removing the mark-up; - insert the fragments at insertion offset, even they are not allowed. Can be: true, false. Default value is true.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.InsertOrReplaceTextOperation',
arg-text, '',
arg-schemaAware, 'true'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Insert an XInclude element


Arguments:

This operation has no arguments.


Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.InsertXIncludeOperation'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Run Javascript code which calls AuthorAccess API by using the predefined field 'authorAccess'.


Arguments:
  • script = The Javascript content to execute. It must have a function called doOperation() which can use the predefined variable "authorAccess". The "authorAccess" variable has access to the entire Java API "ro.sync.ecss.extensions.api.AuthorAccess".

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.JSOperation',
arg-script, ''

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Move the current block element containing the caret offset or the current selected block elements up or down.


Arguments:
  • direction = Move direction can have values "up" or "down"

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.MoveBlockAuthorOperation',
arg-direction, 'up'

field.name: unparsedInsertString
field.String: operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.MoveCaretOperation', arg-xpathLocation, '.', arg-position, 'Inside, at the beginning', arg-selection, 'None'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Author operation capable of moving the caret relative to an XML node identified by an XPath expression. The operation can also select an XML element or its content.


Arguments:
  • xpathLocation = An XPath expression identifying the node relative to which the caret will be moved. If the expression identifies more than one node, only the first one will be taken into account.
  • position = The position relative to the node obtained from the XPath expression where the caret will be moved. When also choosing to perform a selection, "Before" and "Inside, at the beginning" will both place the caret at the beginning of the selection. In the same way, "After" and "Inside, at the end" will place the caret at the end of the selection.
  • selection = This argument specifies if the operation should select the node obtained from the XPath expression, its content or nothing at all.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.MoveCaretOperation',
arg-xpathLocation, '.',
arg-position, 'Inside, at the beginning',
arg-selection, 'None'

field.name: unparsedInsertString
field.String: operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.MoveElementOperation', arg-sourceLocation, '.', arg-moveOnlySourceContentNodes, 'false', arg-deleteLocation, '.', arg-surroundFragment, '<element/>', arg-targetLocation, '.', arg-insertPosition, 'Inside as first child', arg-processTrackedChangesForXPathLocations, 'false', arg-alwaysPreserveTrackedChangesInMovedContent, 'false'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Moves an element to a different location. The element to move as well as the destination are provided through XPath expressions.


Arguments:
  • sourceLocation = An XPath expression that identifies the node to be moved. If missing, the node at caret will be moved.
  • moveOnlySourceContentNodes = Controls whether the source element is moved entirely or just its content (the content of a node consists in text, other nodes or both). If true, the copied fragment consists in just the content of the node identified by the argument 'sourceLocation'. If false, the entire node will be copied.
  • deleteLocation = An XPath expression that identifies the node to be removed. Optional. If missing, the node identified by 'sourceLocation' as being moved will be removed.
  • surroundFragment = A string representation of an XML fragment. The moved node will be inserted in the first leaf will be this fragment and this fragment containing the moved node will be placed at the destination.
  • targetLocation = An XPath expression that identifies the location where the node must be moved to.
  • insertPosition = The insert position relative to the node determined by the "targetLocation" XPath expression. Can be: Before, Inside as first child, Inside as last child or After. Note: If the XPath expression is not defined this argument is ignored
  • processTrackedChangesForXPathLocations = When nodes are located via XPath, if you have nodes deleted with change tracking in the document they are considered as being present by default. But if you set this argument to 'true', the nodes deleted with track changes will be ignored when the xpath locations are computed.
  • alwaysPreserveTrackedChangesInMovedContent = Always preserve track changes in the moved content, regardless of the track changes state

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.MoveElementOperation',
arg-sourceLocation, '.',
arg-moveOnlySourceContentNodes, 'false',
arg-deleteLocation, '.',
arg-surroundFragment, '',
arg-targetLocation, '.',
arg-insertPosition, 'Inside as first child',
arg-processTrackedChangesForXPathLocations, 'false',
arg-alwaysPreserveTrackedChangesInMovedContent, 'false'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Open in default system application


Arguments:
  • resourcePath = An XPath expression that gives the path of the resource that must be opened.
  • isUnparsedEntity = True if the value returned by the resourcePath argument represents the name of an unparsed entity.
  • mediaType = The media type of the file to be opened.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.OpenInSystemAppOperation',
arg-resourcePath, '.',
arg-isUnparsedEntity, 'false',
arg-mediaType, 'html'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Promotes or demotes a list item.


Arguments:
  • promote = Should be true to promote the list item at the caret position, or false to demote it.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.PromoteDemoteItemOperation',
arg-promote, 'false'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Reloads the content of the editor by reading again from the URL used to open it


Arguments:
  • markAsNotModified = After reloading the content the editor may appear as modified. Sometimes, the content is already present on the file server, so the user should not save it again. This flags can be used in these cases to prevent the editor from showing as modified
  • forced = Control whether we force reloading the document even if the content did not change.
  • discard_undoable_edits = Control whether we discard undoable edits.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.ReloadContentOperation',
arg-markAsNotModified, 'false',
arg-forced, 'true',
arg-discard_undoable_edits, 'false'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Removes the pseudo class for an element.


Arguments:
  • elementLocation = An XPath expression indicating the element or elements whose pseudo-class will be changed. Note: If this is not defined then the element at the caret position will be used.
  • name = The pseudo-class name.
  • includeAllNodes = The value should be "yes" in order to include comments, text and CDATA nodes in the XPath execution, "no" to ignore them.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.RemovePseudoClassOperation',
arg-elementLocation, '.',
arg-name, '',
arg-includeAllNodes, 'no'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Renames the elements identified by the given XPath expression or the current element if no XPath is provided.


Arguments:
  • elementName = A string representing the new elements' qualified name. To declare a new namespace, append to the qualified name the pound (#) character and the namespace declaration.
  • elementLocation = An XPath expression indicating the elements to be renamed. Note: If it is not defined then the element at the caret position will be used.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.RenameElementOperation',
arg-elementName, '',
arg-elementLocation, '.'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Replaces the content of a document.


Arguments:
  • content = The new content of the document.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.ReplaceContentOperation',
arg-content, ''

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Replaces the content of the fully selected element or the content of the element at caret (if the selection is empty or a node is not entirely selected)


Arguments:
  • elementLocation = An XPath expression indicating the element whose attribute will be changed. Note: If it is not defined then the element at the caret position or the current fully selected element will be used.
  • fragment = The new content of the element.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.ReplaceElementContentOperation',
arg-elementLocation, '.',
arg-fragment, ''

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Sets the pseudo class for an element.


Arguments:
  • elementLocation = An XPath expression indicating the element or elements whose pseudo-class will be changed. Note: If this is not defined then the element at the caret position will be used.
  • name = The pseudo-class name.
  • includeAllNodes = The value should be "yes" in order to include comments, text and CDATA nodes in the XPath execution, "no" to ignore them.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.SetPseudoClassOperation',
arg-elementLocation, '.',
arg-name, '',
arg-includeAllNodes, 'no'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Changes the document read-only status.


Arguments:
  • read-only = Sets the read-only status of the current document.Can be: - true: for making the document read-only - false: for making the document writable Default value is true.
  • reason = The reason for the document being read-only. It will be displayed when the user tries to edit the document. If not specified, a default message will be displayed to the user.
  • reason-code = The code for the reason for the document being read-only. It will be accessible through API. Optional.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.SetReadOnlyStatusOperation',
arg-read-only, 'true',
arg-reason, '',
arg-reason-code, ''

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Shows the current element documentation in reference manual.


Arguments:
  • URL pattern = The URL pattern of elements documentation.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.ShowElementDocumentationOperation',
arg-URL pattern, ''

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Stop the current running transformation scenario.


Arguments:

This operation has no arguments.


Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.StopCurrentTransformationScenarioOperation'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Surround the selected text with a document fragment. If there is no selection the fragment will be inserted at the current position.


Arguments:
  • fragment = The fragment to surround with. The first leaf will be the destination of the text to surround. If the first leaf is not the desired location for the surrounded fragment, you can use the "InsertOrReplaceFragmentOperation" operation and set the folllowing arguments: - fragment: The XML fragment that will surround the selection. Use the ${selection} editor variable in the location you want to place the surrounded fragment. - schemaAware: Set to false, to avoid moving the fragment if it is not valid at the given location.
  • schemaAware = Controlling if the insertion is schema aware or not. When the schema aware is enabled and the fragments insertion is not allowed a dialog will be shown, proposing solutions, like: - insert the fragments inside a new element. The name of the element to wrap the fragments in is computed by analyzing the left or right siblings; - split an ancestor of the node at insertion offset and insert the fragments between the resulted elements; - insert the fragments somewhere in the proximity of the insertion offset(left or right without skipping content); Note: if a selection exists the surround with fragment operation is not schema aware. Can be: true, false. Default value is true.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.SurroundWithFragmentOperation',
arg-fragment, '',
arg-schemaAware, 'true'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Surround a selection with text. Places a header at the start of the selection and a footer at the end.If no selection exists, the word at caret will be surrounded.


Arguments:
  • header = The text to append before
  • footer = The text to append after

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.SurroundWithTextOperation',
arg-header, '',
arg-footer, ''

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Wrap selection in an XML comment or unwrap existing XML comment


Arguments:

This operation has no arguments.


Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.ToggleCommentOperation'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Toggles on/off the pseudo-class of an element.


Arguments:
  • elementLocation = An XPath expression indicating the element or elements whose pseudo-class will be changed. Note: If this is not defined then the element at the caret position will be used.
  • name = The pseudo-class name.
  • includeAllNodes = The value should be "yes" in order to include comments, text and CDATA nodes in the XPath execution, "no" to ignore them.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.TogglePseudoClassOperation',
arg-elementLocation, '.',
arg-name, '',
arg-includeAllNodes, 'no'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Toggle "surround with element" operation. If there is no selection in the document and the caret is inside a word, the word is wrapped in the given element (or unwrapped if it is already included in the element), else the fragment is inserted at caret position. If there is a selection in the document, it is wrapped in the given element (or unwrapped if it is already included in the element).


Arguments:
  • element = The element to surround with.
  • schemaAware = This argument applies only on the surround with element operation and controls if the insertion is schema aware or not. When schema aware is enabled and the element insertion is not allowed, a dialog will be shown proposing insertion solutions, like: - splitting an ancestor of the node at insertion offset and inserting the element between the resulted elements; - inserting the element somewhere in the proximity of the insertion offset (left or right without skipping content); - inserting the element at insertion offset, even it is not allowed. Note: if a selection exists the surround with element operation is not schema aware. Possible values are: true, false. Default value is true.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.ToggleSurroundWithElementOperation',
arg-element, '',
arg-schemaAware, 'true'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Unwrap element tags.


Arguments:
  • unwrapElementLocation = An XPath expression indicating the element to unwrap. Note: If it is not defined then the element at the caret is unwrapped.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.UnwrapTagsOperation',
arg-unwrapElementLocation, '.'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Marks the Web Author document as saved.


Arguments:

This operation has no arguments.


Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.WebappMarkAsSavedOperation'

field.name: unparsedInsertString
field.String: operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.XQueryOperation', arg-sourceLocation, '.', arg-targetLocation, '.', arg-script, '', arg-action, 'Replace', arg-caretPosition, 'First editable position', arg-expandEditorVariables, 'true', arg-suspendTrackChanges, 'false', arg-externalParams, '', arg-alwaysPreserveTrackedChangesBeforeProcessing, 'false'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Run an XQuery script on a source element and then replace or insert the result in a target element.


Arguments:
  • sourceLocation = An XPath expression indicating the element that the script will be applied on. Note: If it is not defined then the element at the caret position will be used.
  • targetLocation = An XPath expression indicating the insert location for the result of the transformation. Note: If it is not defined then the insert location will be at the caret.
  • script = A path to the script or the script itself. When using a path the following apply: - a relative path is resolved to the framework directory. - the ${framework} editor variable can also be used to refer resources from the framework directory. - the path is passed through the catalog mappings. If you provide the actual script, the base system ID for this will be the framework file, so any include/import reference will be resolved relative to the ".framework" file that contains this action definition
  • action = The insert action relative to the node determined by the target XPath expression. It can be: Replace, At caret position, Before, After, Inside as first child or Inside as last child.
  • caretPosition = The position of the caret after the action is executed. It can be: Preserve, Before, Start, First editable position, End or After.
  • expandEditorVariables = Parameter controlling the expansion of editor variables returned by the script processing. Expansion is enabled by default.
  • suspendTrackChanges = Disable Track Changes during the operation's execution. By default the state of track changes is not altered.
  • externalParams = Provide external parameters to the script. Should be inserted as name=value pairs separated by comma or line break.
  • alwaysPreserveTrackedChangesBeforeProcessing = Always preserve tracked changes before processing, regardless of the track changes state.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.XQueryOperation',
arg-sourceLocation, '.',
arg-targetLocation, '.',
arg-script, '',
arg-action, 'Replace',
arg-caretPosition, 'First editable position',
arg-expandEditorVariables, 'true',
arg-suspendTrackChanges, 'false',
arg-externalParams, '',
arg-alwaysPreserveTrackedChangesBeforeProcessing, 'false'

field.name: descriptionString

Description:

Executes an XQuery Update script.


Arguments:

When using a path the following apply: - a relative path is resolved to the framework directory. - the ${framework} editor variable can also be used to refer resources from the framework directory. - the path is passed through the catalog mappings. If you provide the actual script, the base system ID for this will be the framework file, so any include/import reference will be resolved relative to the ".framework" file that contains this action definition
  • externalParams = Provide external parameters to the xquery script. Should be inserted as name=value pairs separated by comma or line break.
  • expandXincludeReferences = Add the elements referred through XInclude to the document model.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.XQueryUpdateOperation',
arg-script, '',
arg-externalParams, '',
arg-expandXincludeReferences, 'false'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Run an XSLT script on a source element and then replace or insert the result in a target element.


Arguments:
  • sourceLocation = An XPath expression indicating the element that the script will be applied on. Note: If it is not defined then the element at the caret position will be used.
  • targetLocation = An XPath expression indicating the insert location for the result of the transformation. Note: If it is not defined then the insert location will be at the caret.
  • script = A path to the script or the script itself. When using a path the following apply: - a relative path is resolved to the framework directory. - the ${framework} editor variable can also be used to refer resources from the framework directory. - the path is passed through the catalog mappings. If you provide the actual script, the base system ID for this will be the framework file, so any include/import reference will be resolved relative to the ".framework" file that contains this action definition
  • action = The insert action relative to the node determined by the target XPath expression. It can be: Replace, At caret position, Before, After, Inside as first child or Inside as last child.
  • caretPosition = The position of the caret after the action is executed. It can be: Preserve, Before, Start, First editable position, End or After.
  • expandEditorVariables = Parameter controlling the expansion of editor variables returned by the script processing. Expansion is enabled by default.
  • suspendTrackChanges = Disable Track Changes during the operation's execution. By default the state of track changes is not altered.
  • externalParams = Provide external parameters to the script. Should be inserted as name=value pairs separated by comma or line break.
  • alwaysPreserveTrackedChangesBeforeProcessing = Always preserve tracked changes before processing, regardless of the track changes state.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.XSLTOperation',
arg-sourceLocation, '.',
arg-targetLocation, '.',
arg-script, '',
arg-action, 'Replace',
arg-caretPosition, 'First editable position',
arg-expandEditorVariables, 'true',
arg-suspendTrackChanges, 'false',
arg-externalParams, '',
arg-alwaysPreserveTrackedChangesBeforeProcessing, 'false'

field.String: operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.ChangeAttributeOperation', arg-elementLocation, '.', arg-name, '', arg-namespace, '', arg-value, '', arg-removeIfEmpty, 'true', arg-editAttribute, 'true'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Add/change/remove an attribute of an element.


Arguments:
  • elementLocation = An XPath expression indicating the element whose attribute will be changed. Note: If it is not defined then the element at the caret position will be used.
  • name = The attribute local name.
  • namespace = The attribute namespace. Leave it empty for no namespace.
  • value = The attribute value. Set it empty to remove the attribute.
  • removeIfEmpty = True means that the attribute should be removed if an empty value is provided. The default behavior is to remove it.
  • editAttribute = If an in-place editor exists for this attribute, it will automatically activate the in-pace editor and it will start editing.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.ChangeAttributeOperation',
arg-elementLocation, '.',
arg-name, '',
arg-namespace, '',
arg-value, '',
arg-removeIfEmpty, 'true',
arg-editAttribute, 'true'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Add/change/remove one or more attributes for one or more elements.


Arguments:
  • elementLocations = An XPath expression indicating the elements whose attributes will be affected. Note: If it is not defined, then the element at the caret position will be used.
  • attributeNames = The names of the attributes to change/insert/remove, each on a new line. The provided values can be local names or Clark notations {attribute_namespace}attibute_name.
  • values = The attribute values, each on a new line. An empty value will remove the corresponding attribute if 'removeIfEmpty' is set to 'true' (it is by default).
  • removeIfEmpty = 'true' means the attribute should be removed if an empty value is provided. The default value is 'true'.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.ChangeAttributesOperation',
arg-elementLocations, '.',
arg-attributeNames, '',
arg-values, '',
arg-removeIfEmpty, 'true'

field.name: unparsedInsertString
field.String: operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.ChangePseudoClassesOperation', arg-setLocations, '.', arg-setPseudoClassNames, '', arg-removeLocations, '.', arg-removePseudoClassNames, '', arg-includeAllNodes, 'no'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Sets a set of pseudo classes to all nodes identified by an XPath expression. Removes a set of pseudo classes from all nodes identified by an XPath expression.


Arguments:
  • setLocations = An XPath expression indicating a list of nodes on which the specified list of pseudo classes will be set. Note: If it is not defined, then the element at the caret position will be used.
  • setPseudoClassNames = A space-separated list of pseudo class names which will be set on the matched nodes.
  • removeLocations = An XPath expression indicating a list of nodes from which the specified list of pseudo classes will be removed. Note: If it is not defined, then the element at the caret position will be used.
  • removePseudoClassNames = A space-separated list of pseudo class names which will be removed from the matched nodes.
  • includeAllNodes = The value should be "yes" in order to include comments, text and CDATA nodes in the XPath execution, "no" to ignore them.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.ChangePseudoClassesOperation',
arg-setLocations, '.',
arg-setPseudoClassNames, '',
arg-removeLocations, '.',
arg-removePseudoClassNames, '',
arg-includeAllNodes, 'no'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Deletes the element specified by an XPath expression or the element at the caret position


Arguments:
  • elementLocation = An XPath expression indicating the element to be deleted. Note: If it is not defined, then the element at the caret position will be used.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.DeleteElementOperation',
arg-elementLocation, '.'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Deletes the elements specified by an XPath expression or the element at the caret position


Arguments:
  • elementLocations = An XPath expression indicating the elements to be deleted. Note: If it is not defined then the element at the caret position will be used.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.DeleteElementsOperation',
arg-elementLocations, '.'

field.name: unparsedInsertString
field.String: operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.ExecuteCommandLineOperation', arg-name, 'Command Line Operation', arg-workingDirectory, '.', arg-cmdLine, '', arg-showConsole, 'false', arg-wait, 'false'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Author operation allowing the execution of command lines.


Arguments:
  • name = The name of the operation. It will also be used as the name of the console.
  • workingDirectory = The path to the working directory where the command line will be executed.
  • cmdLine = The command line to be executed. It can contain oXygen editor variables. IMPORTANT: This operation is meant for executing programs. Not any string that a command line interpreter (or shell) accepts can be run by this operation.For example, the "dir" command line from Windows is not accepted as it is. The accepted form is "cmd /c dir".
  • showConsole = True to show the console when running the command line.
  • wait = True to wait until the command terminates to return.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.ExecuteCommandLineOperation',
arg-name, 'Command Line Operation',
arg-workingDirectory, '.',
arg-cmdLine, '',
arg-showConsole, 'false',
arg-wait, 'false'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Run a named transformation scenario with specific parameters defined in the associated document type.


Arguments:
  • scenarioName = The name of the transformation scenario which will be executed.
  • scenarioParameters = Provided parameters for the transformation scenario. Parameters are inserted as name=value pairs separated by line breaks. The set parameters are taken into account for XSLT, DITA, Chemistry and ANT Transformation scenario types.
  • markInProgressXPathLocation = XPath expression that identifies the element(s) on which a specific '-oxy-transformation-in-progress' pseudo class is set before transformation is started.The pseudo class is reset when the transformation ends.If this XPath expression is not defined, the current node is used.
  • markOthersInProgressXPathLocation = XPath expression that indentifies other elements on which a specific '-oxy-transformation-in-progress-others' pseudo class is set before the transformation is started.The pseudo class is reset when the transformation ends.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.ExecuteCustomizableTransformationScenarioOperation',
arg-scenarioName, '',
arg-scenarioParameters, '',
arg-markInProgressXPathLocation, '',
arg-markOthersInProgressXPathLocation, ''

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:

Run a sequence of actions defined in the associated document type.


Arguments:

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.ExecuteMultipleActionsOperation',
arg-actionIDs, ''

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Run a sequence of actions defined in the associated document type.

  • actionIDs = The IDs of the actions that will be executed in sequence, separated either by new lines or by commas.

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.ExecuteMultipleWebappCompatibleActionsOperation',
arg-actionIDs, ''

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Run a named transformation scenario defined in the associated document type.


Arguments:
  • scenarioNames = The names of the transformation scenario which will be executed, separated by new lines.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.ExecuteTransformationScenariosOperation',
arg-scenarioNames, ''

field.String:

Run a named validation scenario defined in the associated document type.

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Insert a MathML equation.


Arguments:
  • fragment = The fragment of XML containing the default MathML content which should be inserted

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.InsertEquationOperation',
arg-fragment, ''

field.name: unparsedInsertString
field.String: operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.InsertFragmentOperation', arg-fragment, '<element/>', arg-insertLocation, '.', arg-insertPosition, 'Inside as first child', arg-schemaAware, 'true', arg-insertEvenIfInvalid, 'true', arg-goToNextEditablePosition, 'true'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Insert a document fragment.


Arguments:
  • fragment = The fragment to be inserted
  • insertLocation = An XPath expression indicating the insert location for the fragment. Note: If it is not defined then the insert location will be at the caret.
  • insertPosition = The insert position relative to the node determined by the XPath expression. Can be: Before, Inside as first child, Inside as last child or After. Note: If the XPath expression is not defined this argument is ignored
  • schemaAware = Controlling if the insertion is schema aware or not. When is enabled and the fragments insertion is not allowed, a dialog will be shown proposing one of following solutions if they apply: - insert the fragments inside a new element. The name of the element to wrap the fragments in is computed by analyzing the left or right siblings; - split an ancestor of the node at insertion offset and insert the fragments between the resulted elements; - insert the fragments somewhere in the proximity of the insertion offset(left or right without skipping content); - insert at offset the plain text resulted after removing the mark-up; - insert the fragments at insertion offset, even they are not allowed. Can be: true, false. Default value is true.
  • insertEvenIfInvalid = True to insert the fragment even if invalid, when 'schemaAware' is set to 'true'.
  • goToNextEditablePosition = After inserting the fragment, the first editable position is detected and the caret is placed at that location. It handles any in-place editors used to edit attributes. It will be ignored if the fragment specifies a caret position using the caret editor variable.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.InsertFragmentOperation',
arg-fragment, '',
arg-insertLocation, '.',
arg-insertPosition, 'Inside as first child',
arg-schemaAware, 'true',
arg-insertEvenIfInvalid, 'true',
arg-goToNextEditablePosition, 'true'

field.name: unparsedInsertString
field.String: operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.InsertOrReplaceFragmentOperation', arg-fragment, '<element/>', arg-insertLocation, '.', arg-insertPosition, 'Inside as first child', arg-schemaAware, 'true', arg-goToNextEditablePosition, 'true'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Insert a document fragment. If selection is present, the selection will be replaced with the given fragment.


Arguments:
  • fragment = The fragment to be inserted
  • insertLocation = An XPath expression indicating the insert location for the fragment. Note: If it is not defined then the insert location will be at the caret.
  • insertPosition = The insert position relative to the node determined by the XPath expression. Can be: Before, Inside as first child, Inside as last child, Replace or After. Note: If the XPath expression is not defined this argument is ignored
  • schemaAware = Controlling if the insertion is schema aware or not. When is enabled and the fragments insertion is not allowed, a dialog will be shown proposing one of following solutions if they apply: - insert the fragments inside a new element. The name of the element to wrap the fragments in is computed by analyzing the left or right siblings; - split an ancestor of the node at insertion offset and insert the fragments between the resulted elements; - insert the fragments somewhere in the proximity of the insertion offset(left or right without skipping content); - insert at offset the plain text resulted after removing the mark-up; - insert the fragments at insertion offset, even they are not allowed. Can be: true, false. Default value is true.
  • goToNextEditablePosition = After inserting the fragment, the first editable position is detected and the caret is placed at that location. It handles any in-place editors used to edit attributes. It will be ignored if the fragment specifies a caret position using the caret editor variable.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.InsertOrReplaceFragmentOperation',
arg-fragment, '',
arg-insertLocation, '.',
arg-insertPosition, 'Inside as first child',
arg-schemaAware, 'true',
arg-goToNextEditablePosition, 'true'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Insert a simple text. If selection is present, the selected text will be replaced with the new one.


Arguments:
  • text = The text to be inserted
  • schemaAware = Controlling if the insertion is schema aware or not. When is enabled and the fragments insertion is not allowed, a dialog will be shown proposing one of following solutions if they apply: - insert the fragments inside a new element. The name of the element to wrap the fragments in is computed by analyzing the left or right siblings; - split an ancestor of the node at insertion offset and insert the fragments between the resulted elements; - insert the fragments somewhere in the proximity of the insertion offset(left or right without skipping content); - insert at offset the plain text resulted after removing the mark-up; - insert the fragments at insertion offset, even they are not allowed. Can be: true, false. Default value is true.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.InsertOrReplaceTextOperation',
arg-text, '',
arg-schemaAware, 'true'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Insert an XInclude element


Arguments:

This operation has no arguments.


Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.InsertXIncludeOperation'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Run Javascript code which calls AuthorAccess API by using the predefined field 'authorAccess'.


Arguments:
  • script = The Javascript content to execute. It must have a function called doOperation() which can use the predefined variable "authorAccess". The "authorAccess" variable has access to the entire Java API "ro.sync.ecss.extensions.api.AuthorAccess".

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.JSOperation',
arg-script, ''

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Move the current block element containing the caret offset or the current selected block elements up or down.


Arguments:
  • direction = Move direction can have values "up" or "down"

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.MoveBlockAuthorOperation',
arg-direction, 'up'

field.name: unparsedInsertString
field.String: operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.MoveCaretOperation', arg-xpathLocation, '.', arg-position, 'Inside, at the beginning', arg-selection, 'None'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Author operation capable of moving the caret relative to an XML node identified by an XPath expression. The operation can also select an XML element or its content.


Arguments:
  • xpathLocation = An XPath expression identifying the node relative to which the caret will be moved. If the expression identifies more than one node, only the first one will be taken into account.
  • position = The position relative to the node obtained from the XPath expression where the caret will be moved. When also choosing to perform a selection, "Before" and "Inside, at the beginning" will both place the caret at the beginning of the selection. In the same way, "After" and "Inside, at the end" will place the caret at the end of the selection.
  • selection = This argument specifies if the operation should select the node obtained from the XPath expression, its content or nothing at all.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.MoveCaretOperation',
arg-xpathLocation, '.',
arg-position, 'Inside, at the beginning',
arg-selection, 'None'

field.name: unparsedInsertString
field.String: operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.MoveElementOperation', arg-sourceLocation, '.', arg-moveOnlySourceContentNodes, 'false', arg-deleteLocation, '.', arg-surroundFragment, '<element/>', arg-targetLocation, '.', arg-insertPosition, 'Inside as first child', arg-processTrackedChangesForXPathLocations, 'false', arg-alwaysPreserveTrackedChangesInMovedContent, 'false'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Moves an element to a different location. The element to move as well as the destination are provided through XPath expressions.


Arguments:
  • sourceLocation = An XPath expression that identifies the node to be moved. If missing, the node at caret will be moved.
  • moveOnlySourceContentNodes = Controls whether the source element is moved entirely or just its content (the content of a node consists in text, other nodes or both). If true, the copied fragment consists in just the content of the node identified by the argument 'sourceLocation'. If false, the entire node will be copied.
  • deleteLocation = An XPath expression that identifies the node to be removed. Optional. If missing, the node identified by 'sourceLocation' as being moved will be removed.
  • surroundFragment = A string representation of an XML fragment. The moved node will be inserted in the first leaf will be this fragment and this fragment containing the moved node will be placed at the destination.
  • targetLocation = An XPath expression that identifies the location where the node must be moved to.
  • insertPosition = The insert position relative to the node determined by the "targetLocation" XPath expression. Can be: Before, Inside as first child, Inside as last child or After. Note: If the XPath expression is not defined this argument is ignored
  • processTrackedChangesForXPathLocations = When nodes are located via XPath, if you have nodes deleted with change tracking in the document they are considered as being present by default. But if you set this argument to 'true', the nodes deleted with track changes will be ignored when the xpath locations are computed.
  • alwaysPreserveTrackedChangesInMovedContent = Always preserve track changes in the moved content, regardless of the track changes state

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.MoveElementOperation',
arg-sourceLocation, '.',
arg-moveOnlySourceContentNodes, 'false',
arg-deleteLocation, '.',
arg-surroundFragment, '',
arg-targetLocation, '.',
arg-insertPosition, 'Inside as first child',
arg-processTrackedChangesForXPathLocations, 'false',
arg-alwaysPreserveTrackedChangesInMovedContent, 'false'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Open in default system application


Arguments:
  • resourcePath = An XPath expression that gives the path of the resource that must be opened.
  • isUnparsedEntity = True if the value returned by the resourcePath argument represents the name of an unparsed entity.
  • mediaType = The media type of the file to be opened.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.OpenInSystemAppOperation',
arg-resourcePath, '.',
arg-isUnparsedEntity, 'false',
arg-mediaType, 'html'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Promotes or demotes a list item.


Arguments:
  • promote = Should be true to promote the list item at the caret position, or false to demote it.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.PromoteDemoteItemOperation',
arg-promote, 'false'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Reloads the content of the editor by reading again from the URL used to open it


Arguments:
  • markAsNotModified = After reloading the content the editor may appear as modified. Sometimes, the content is already present on the file server, so the user should not save it again. This flags can be used in these cases to prevent the editor from showing as modified
  • forced = Control whether we force reloading the document even if the content did not change.
  • discard_undoable_edits = Control whether we discard undoable edits.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.ReloadContentOperation',
arg-markAsNotModified, 'false',
arg-forced, 'true',
arg-discard_undoable_edits, 'false'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Removes the pseudo class for an element.


Arguments:
  • elementLocation = An XPath expression indicating the element or elements whose pseudo-class will be changed. Note: If this is not defined then the element at the caret position will be used.
  • name = The pseudo-class name.
  • includeAllNodes = The value should be "yes" in order to include comments, text and CDATA nodes in the XPath execution, "no" to ignore them.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.RemovePseudoClassOperation',
arg-elementLocation, '.',
arg-name, '',
arg-includeAllNodes, 'no'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Renames the elements identified by the given XPath expression or the current element if no XPath is provided.


Arguments:

  • elementLocation = An XPath expression indicating the elements to be renamed. Note: If it is not defined then the element at the caret position will be used.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.RenameElementOperation',
arg-elementName, '',
arg-elementLocation, '.'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Changes the document read-only status.


Arguments:
  • read-only = Sets the read-only status of the current document.Can be: - true: for making the document read-only - false: for making the document writable Default value is true.
  • reason = The reason for the document being read-only. It will be displayed when the user tries to edit the document. If not specified, a default message will be displayed to the user.
  • reason-code = The code for the reason for the document being read-only. It will be accessible through API. Optional.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.SetReadOnlyStatusOperation',
arg-read-only, 'true',
arg-reason, '',
arg-reason-code, ''

field.String:

Stop the current running transformation scenario.


Arguments:

This operation has no arguments.


Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.StopCurrentTransformationScenarioOperation'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Surround the selected text with a document fragment. If there is no selection the fragment will be inserted at the current position.


Arguments:
  • fragment = The fragment to surround with. The first leaf will be the destination of the text to surround. If the first leaf is not the desired location for the surrounded fragment, you can use the "InsertOrReplaceFragmentOperation" operation and set the folllowing arguments: - fragment: The XML fragment that will surround the selection. Use the ${selection} editor variable in the location you want to place the surrounded fragment. - schemaAware: Set to false, to avoid moving the fragment if it is not valid at the given location.
  • schemaAware = Controlling if the insertion is schema aware or not. When the schema aware is enabled and the fragments insertion is not allowed a dialog will be shown, proposing solutions, like: - insert the fragments inside a new element. The name of the element to wrap the fragments in is computed by analyzing the left or right siblings; - split an ancestor of the node at insertion offset and insert the fragments between the resulted elements; - insert the fragments somewhere in the proximity of the insertion offset(left or right without skipping content); Note: if a selection exists the surround with fragment operation is not schema aware. Can be: true, false. Default value is true.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.SurroundWithFragmentOperation',
arg-fragment, '',
arg-schemaAware, 'true'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Surround a selection with text. Places a header at the start of the selection and a footer at the end.If no selection exists, the word at caret will be surrounded.


Arguments:
  • header = The text to append before
  • footer = The text to append after

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.SurroundWithTextOperation',
arg-header, '',
arg-footer, ''

Arguments:

  • name = The pseudo-class name.
  • includeAllNodes = The value should be "yes" in order to include comments, text and CDATA nodes in the XPath execution, "no" to ignore them.

arg-elementLocation, '.',
arg-name, '',
arg-includeAllNodes, 'no'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Toggle "surround with element" operation. If there is no selection in the document and the caret is inside a word, the word is wrapped in the given element (or unwrapped if it is already included in the element), else the fragment is inserted at caret position. If there is a selection in the document, it is wrapped in the given element (or unwrapped if it is already included in the element).


Arguments:
  • element = The element to surround with.
  • schemaAware = This argument applies only on the surround with element operation and controls if the insertion is schema aware or not. When schema aware is enabled and the element insertion is not allowed, a dialog will be shown proposing insertion solutions, like: - splitting an ancestor of the node at insertion offset and inserting the element between the resulted elements; - inserting the element somewhere in the proximity of the insertion offset (left or right without skipping content); - inserting the element at insertion offset, even it is not allowed. Note: if a selection exists the surround with element operation is not schema aware. Possible values are: true, false. Default value is true.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.ToggleSurroundWithElementOperation',
arg-element, '',
arg-schemaAware, 'true'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:

Unwrap element tags.


Arguments:
  • unwrapElementLocation = An XPath expression indicating the element to unwrap. Note: If it is not defined then the element at the caret is unwrapped.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.UnwrapTagsOperation',
arg-unwrapElementLocation, '.'

field.name: unparsedInsertString
field.String: operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.XQueryOperation', arg-sourceLocation, '.', arg-targetLocation, '.', arg-script, '', arg-action, 'Replace', arg-caretPosition, 'First editable position', arg-expandEditorVariables, 'true', arg-suspendTrackChanges, 'false', arg-externalParams, '', arg-alwaysPreserveTrackedChangesBeforeProcessing, 'false'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Run an XQuery script on a source element and then replace or insert the result in a target element.


Arguments:
  • sourceLocation = An XPath expression indicating the element that the script will be applied on. Note: If it is not defined then the element at the caret position will be used.
  • targetLocation = An XPath expression indicating the insert location for the result of the transformation. Note: If it is not defined then the insert location will be at the caret.
  • script = A path to the script or the script itself. When using a path the following apply: - a relative path is resolved to the framework directory. - the ${framework} editor variable can also be used to refer resources from the framework directory. - the path is passed through the catalog mappings. If you provide the actual script, the base system ID for this will be the framework file, so any include/import reference will be resolved relative to the ".framework" file that contains this action definition
  • action = The insert action relative to the node determined by the target XPath expression. It can be: Replace, At caret position, Before, After, Inside as first child or Inside as last child.
  • caretPosition = The position of the caret after the action is executed. It can be: Preserve, Before, Start, First editable position, End or After.
  • expandEditorVariables = Parameter controlling the expansion of editor variables returned by the script processing. Expansion is enabled by default.
  • suspendTrackChanges = Disable Track Changes during the operation's execution. By default the state of track changes is not altered.
  • externalParams = Provide external parameters to the script. Should be inserted as name=value pairs separated by comma or line break.
  • alwaysPreserveTrackedChangesBeforeProcessing = Always preserve tracked changes before processing, regardless of the track changes state.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.XQueryOperation',
arg-sourceLocation, '.',
arg-targetLocation, '.',
arg-script, '',
arg-action, 'Replace',
arg-caretPosition, 'First editable position',
arg-expandEditorVariables, 'true',
arg-suspendTrackChanges, 'false',
arg-externalParams, '',
arg-alwaysPreserveTrackedChangesBeforeProcessing, 'false'

field.name: descriptionString
field.String:
Description:

Executes an XQuery Update script.


Arguments:
  • script = A path to the script or the script itself. When using a path the following apply: - a relative path is resolved to the framework directory. - the ${framework} editor variable can also be used to refer resources from the framework directory. - the path is passed through the catalog mappings. If you provide the actual script, the base system ID for this will be the framework file, so any include/import reference will be resolved relative to the ".framework" file that contains this action definition
  • externalParams = Provide external parameters to the xquery script. Should be inserted as name=value pairs separated by comma or line break.
  • expandXincludeReferences = Add the elements referred through XInclude to the document model.

Template:

operation, 'ro.sync.ecss.extensions.commons.operations.XQueryUpdateOperation',
arg-script, '',
arg-externalParams, '',
arg-expandXincludeReferences, 'false'
